title: Prime Minister of India - Wikipedia
snippet: During his tenure, the country retained the economic momentum gained during Prime Minister Vajpayee's tenure. Apart from this, the government succeeded in getting the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005, and the Right to Information Act, 2005 passed in the parliament.

title: Why Nehru became the first Prime Minister of India instead of Patel? | Revisiting India
snippet: By Sandeep Bhardwaj One of the pernicious myths of Indian politics that refuses to die is the claim that Jawaharlal Nehru somehow “stole” India’s premiership from Vallabhbhai Patel.

title: List of prime ministers of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Earlier, Nehru had served as prime minister of the Interim Government of India during the British Raj from 2 September 1946 until 14 August 1947, his party, the Indian National Congress having won the 1946 Indian provincial elections. title: President of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Arunachal Pradesh governor Jyoti Prasad Rajkhowa, who was earlier appointed by the ruling party at the centre, was sacked by President Pranab Mukherjee after the Supreme Court struck down his unconstitutional acts.
